editorialNotes.standard: If you can imagine it, you can create it—anything from monolithic towers to cavernous rollercoasters. That’s the idea that sparked a world-building phenomenon in Mojang’s amazing Minecraft. Since the game's release on the App Store, a steady stream of meaningful updates has kept this cube-filled universe fun, fresh and jam-packed with exciting features.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.tagline: Don't let the zombies stop you

ios.subtitle: Guess the word with video chat
Roll the Dice, Pass Go & Win

Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Everyone needs a task manager – and this Apple Design Award winner is adaptable enough for anyone. Organising items is as simple as dragging them where you want them, and the Magic Plus button makes it easy to add to-dos from anywhere in the app.

The infection has begun and it’s up to you to strategically spread and evolve a deadly plague to bring about the end of the human race. Saving the world and being a hero is honourable, but decimating the world with a deadly infection is a whole lot of fun — even though it shouldn’t be.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: After a long day at work, it’s bath time! But Swampy’s shower is broken and he needs your help to guide the water to him. Navigate a path through the dirt past contraptions and obstacles to get every drop to fill the bath.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Build the perfect commute on your next commute with the hypnotic Mini Metro. Strategy buffs and casual gamers alike will enjoy expanding a busy transit system by linking stations, directing trains and upgrading lines. There’s a thrilling satisfaction in seeing underground lines come together—and since no two games play alike, we’re always trying out new designs.
editorialNotes.short: Construct the perfect commute in this underground masterpiece.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Catchy music, incredible combo-filled combat, co-op play and a blast of nostalgic spirit ensures this classic brawling series still packs a punch.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

name: Brothers: A Tale of Two Sons

editorialNotes.tagline: Two heads are better than one

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.short: Explore endless vertical worlds controlling a four-legged alien.

editorialNotes.standard: Revenge is a dish served with epic property damage and plenty of attitude when a princess and her pet dragon decide they’re tired of getting captured. It’s pure destructive joy guiding this royal duo over (and under) a gorgeous fantasy landscape of fleeing knights, treacherous traps, and mighty bosses to smash. The game pops with personality—and its simple controls, slick level design, and upgradable equipment keep the challenge fun and fresh.

editorialNotes.tagline: Team up to solve the puzzles

name: Loco Pets: Fox & Cat co op
真武三国  英雄集结

editorialNotes.standard: Terry Cavanagh’s Super Hexagon is quite simply one of the most challenging games we’ve ever played. A pulsating chiptunes soundtrack underscores the danger as swirling walls close in around you and you race to escape the contracting maze. With the geometric action heaping on the punishment (the easiest difficulty is appropriately labelled “Hard”), every small achievement feels like a massive victory, whether you’re topping your high score or overcoming a singularly tricky section.
editorialNotes.short: This is still one of our favourites. Few games are this satisfying to master.

name: Cut the Rope: Time Travel GOLD

ios.subtitle: Om Nom goes to the past

editorialNotes.standard: Part platformer, part puzzler, Edge has infatuated gamers almost since the opening of the App Store. Guide a nimble cube around the narrow ledges and ever-shifting corridors of a treacherous 3D world, unlocking secrets and collecting items without falling into space. Stylishly minimalist visuals and a slick electronic soundtrack make Edge’s mix of path-finding challenges and pitfall-avoiding thrills easy to get lost in. Its dozens of levels of perfectly balanced gameplay redefine how much fun simplicity and sophistication can be.
We love dropping into this city builder’s immersive third-person view, which lets us stroll through bustling neighbourhoods of our own creation.

Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

ios.subtitle: Start and get a survival kit!

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: What secrets lie in the shadows of this Apple Design Award–winning puzzler? By twisting and turning unfathomable objects, you cast shadows on beautifully rendered backgrounds; manipulate them just right and you’ll find shapes you’d never have expected—from rabbits to wrenches. Soothing ambient music and thematic backdrops make completing each challenge as much meditation as entertainment—while timers and achievements give each level a competitive feel.
editorialNotes.short: With stunning visuals and satisfying solutions, this game is one to savour.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

name: 姬魔恋战纪-单机剧情手游戏

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: If they see you coming, it’s too late! Your mind is still your best weapon in the updated version of this sneaky 2006 action game.

Switch on the laser pointer! Scoop the litter! Rub the belly of the all-seeing Pig-a-Corn! This mobile version of the insanely irreverent card game brings the fatal felines to our devices, along with a few purr-fect new twists. The hysterical illustrations by Matthew Inman (creator of The Oatmeal) spring to life with animation and sound—and a meter that tracks the chance of drawing an exploding kitten makes the game even more hilariously tense. Played face-to-face with friends or online against strangers, it’s surprisingly strategic and cat-astrophically fun.

The concept behind Kingdom Rush Frontiers is exceptionally simple: take the same great ideas, visual style, and fiendishly difficult tower defense that millions fell in love with in the original game and improve it by adding tons of incredible content. Frontiers packs new heroes, settings, towers, and tons of fresh enemies to fend off, making the frenzied action even harder to put down.

name: Tsuro - The Game of the Path

editorialNotes.standard: This gorgeous digital board game couldn’t be any simpler to learn, but true mastery lies at the end of a long and winding path. As fans of Tsuro’s tabletop incarnation, we love how faithfully—and beautifully—the experience is re-created here. App-exclusive ways to play add new layers of depth, letting us get lost for hours among these tricky, twisty trails.
